law.text: Any person who after an opportunity to be heard is found by the commissioner to have violated any of the provisions of KRS 241.100, or acted as county administrator in violation of subsection (1) of KRS 241.120, or acted as city administrator or a city employee in violation of subsection (3) of KRS 241.170, or acted as an urban-county administrator in violation of KRS 241.230, shall automatically vacate his office or position, and upon conviction by a court, he shall be guilty of a Class D felony.
law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 557, effective July 15, 2010. -- Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 463, sec. 29, effective June 14, 1992. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 194, sec. 6, effective June 17, 1978. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2554b-106, 2554b-110, 2554b-111.
